Reviews.Title: “Great hotel like no other.”
Reviews.Author: Franco M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Venice other times before this trip. I came with my wife to spend just 2 nights. To me cleanliness is a priority in selecting an accomodation. Location is also a factor when the time to spend in a city is limited. Price enter into the formula of satisfaction when the other two criterias are met. I found the Adriatico Hotel to be very clean, conveniently located and with its breeze of freshly renovated look to be appealing to enjoy the nights in a old city standing for centuries on water. I would reccomend it because this Hotel is a premium 2 stars. The staff is very polite and professional. The breakfast area is a little bit small, but what to expect from a 12 rooms Hotel? Nevertheless their morning breakfast offers the best fresh croissans I ever eat in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not awesome”
Reviews.Author: disney27
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Adriatico had a really good location. If you take the shuttle bus from Marco Polo airport into Venice, it's less than a 10 minute walk to the hotel, or one stop on the water bus if you have a lot of luggage that you don't want to carry. It's on a main road right next to a ton of restaurants, stores, bakeries, gelato places etc. and it's really easy to find your way back to the hotel after wandering the winding, skinny streets of Venice- just follow the signs to Ferrovia and you'll find your way easily. The staff was extremely friendly and everything went smoothly. The breakfast was satisfying enough, and included croissants, breakfast rolls, cereal, yogurt, and a variety of hot beverages/juice. The room and bathroom were clean, but not immaculate. If they just replaced the somewhat outdated bedding/curtains it would make a world of difference. There was also a little bit of street noise, but it didn't bother me too much. I was a little bit disappointed because the website photos make the place look bright and newly updated, which it was not, but as it was clean and in a good location for a good price, I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara D
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little apprehensive about staying here - I worried about cleanliness, comfort level, etc. My boyfriend and I were in Venice for the weekend and were looking for a well-located, cheap(er) option for accommodation in this mostly overpriced city. However, the minute we walked into Hotel Adriatico, my fears were put to rest instantly. First, despite its 2* rating, this hotel is very, VERY clean. The hallways are spotless, and the room (though ordinary-looking) was very comfortable. You don't need to worry about tidiness at all! Second, we received great service. The minute we checked in, the man at the reception desk (I believe he was the manager or owner?) pulled out a map, advised us on tourist sites, and noted which restaurants to avoid. He was quite adamant about avoiding tourist traps and told us everything we needed to know. He basically gave us a briefing on Venice within a span of 10 minutes. Very friendly, very warm staff. Breakfast was average - don't expect a hot breakfast, as you only get bread, cereals, oatmeal, crackers, etc. Third, be warned that this hotel is but of a walk from St. Marks Square - about 20 minutes at a leisurely pace and about 15 minute walk from Rialto Bridge. However, it is the perfect location for getting to and from the bus terminal and/or the train station. You won't need to push your luggage all around the island to get to this hotel - it is literally a 5 minute walk. Overall, this hotel exceeded my (low) expectations and we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to st marks”
Reviews.Author: Criky4
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here. Most reviews say the staff were rude but we didn't find them so. We were in a room off a smelly alley but the staff opened the door promptly which others in trip advisor have said they didn't experience. The location is close to everything with the canal a few doors up the street. I have no complaints really other than the breakfast which on reflection was a bit ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: baynardhouse
Reviews.Content: Not lavish but very clean and tidy and comfortable. Breakfast more satisfying than expected too!

Reviews.Title: “Small but confortable”
Reviews.Author: Sormaumau
Reviews.Content: It is just 5-min walking away from Santa Lucia station and the ferry stop. I had a triple room for 3 nights. Though the room is small, everything else is great. The fresh baked croissants for breakfast and the coffee machine are awesome! =)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: klgirl
Reviews.Content: The location is very near the train station and also on a main street so food and shopping is not a problem. Room and bathroom is a little small but adequate. Room is okay....not very big but enough for the two of us and our two luggages. I will recommend for the hotel to provide floor towels as the floor gets wet after you take a shower..... The reception is managed by senior citizen, polite and speak very simple English but we understand each other. Breakfast is simple and the room is very small....only have 5 small tables and breakfast starts at 8:00 am ( a little late for folks who wants to get an early start). TV has no english shows/news. My only complain is that they only give you 30 mins of free wifi. After that, they charge E1.00 for every 30 minutes. I think in this day and age, wifi should be complementary, even if it is only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: robin m
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel within easy walking distance of the train station. The narrow marble staiway leads to a very freshly painted bright foyer. The staff were all very welcoming and at all times friendly. My room was spotlessly clean and very bright. The breakfast area though small is very adequate. It is an efficiently run hotel, excellent value for Venice and I would highly recommend it for location if arriving by train and pulling luggage. My room was at the front overlooking the street which could be noisy if revellers outside if the window and shutters left open. Otherwise it was fun to look out and watch the passers by.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travel092011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in September and had to rebook our room as we could not get to Venice because there were no trains on that day (streik). So we phoned and all was very uncomplicated. When we arrived the lady at the reception was very friendly. The location is excellent, only a short walk from the train station St. Lucia. A small hotel but easy to find. The room was small but it was ok for us (two adults and one child) and breakfast was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana M
Reviews.Content: We were nicely sirprised to find ourselves in that kind of a small hotel with big hospitality. The story was that before we arrived at Venice to finish our trip home - to Moscow, Russia, we had been staying at a very nice hotel Piroga in Padova for 3 days and we had planned to stay there longer but a friend of ours turned to be in Venice and asked us to join there and we agreed but did not have a chance to book the hotel at such high season. Having arrived at the railway station and getting out of there we found ourselves in front of the Canal Grande. We turned left and walked a little to try to find any cheap hotel as the prices for that week were really very high. Thanks to my friend's intuition we were here, at the Hotel ADRIATICO - we were shocked in a good meaning - it wa clean, white, comfortable hotel with a nice lady at the reception, there was a cozy room with air conditioning and a bathroom with a hair dryer (!) as well as everything you may need to wash and dry :)) At the end of getting surprised so much we woke up the next morning and had a very nice breakfast - not only croissant and tea or coffee but also corn flakes with milk and orange juice. Wow! There was Wi-Fi 2 first hours FREE! We got everything we needed and even more! We slept well - we stayed there for 2 night and we will recommend this very nice hotel to not only our friends :)

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller5039
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May 2011. It is a very short walk from the train station. Our room was on the upper floor (no lifts) and faced on to the busy pedestrian street but with the shutters closed at night it was quiet. The room was very small but had a comfortable bed with great pillows. The air conditioner didn't cope very well with the heat and switches off when you leave the room but we had 2 windows that provided good airflow. Small bathroom with a good shower. Breakfast was OK - rolls, croissants, cereal & youghurt. Considering how expensive everything is in Venice this is reasonably good value for money. Room keys are left at reception when you go out & hung on the wall behind the front desk. They should be out of view as there was not always someone at reception when we returned - security alert!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Adriatico”
Reviews.Author: Marg1965
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in July 2011 with my 3 children and it was fantastic. We arrived late at night and were made to feel most welcome and shown to our room by a very friendly gentleman in reception. We had a two bedroom family room and it was wonderful and we loved our stay. If i ever travel to Venice again i will definitely stay again. The Adriatico was just a short walk from the train station and very easy to find. And we loved Venice as well. Was a welcome rest stop for us on our first overseas holiday from Australia. I cannot recommend them enough. Air-conditioned and clean rooms were perfect. The rooms were exactly as pictured on the web sites.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriatico is conveniently situated, close to Piazzale Roma - Venice main entry point -, closer to Venice's Santa Lucia railroad station and very well connected with the main attractions. Besides that, rooms are clean, comfortable - not big - and quiet. Service is warm and helpful and breakfast is good enough too. Very good quality/price ratio considering you are in the middle of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Eve D
Reviews.Content: Easy to find and a short walk from the train station. Very clean and comfortable, good location, quiet at night. Traveling with my 20 year old daughter to Venice for the weekend, we felt very welcome, safe and comfortable at the Hotel Adriatico. The staff are very friendly, and gave us some great advice saving time and money. We had only a short time in Venice and were glad to have selected the Hotel Adriatico for our stay. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel at Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mulan80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Adriatico at Venice. We are glad we chose this hotel (thanks to tripadvisor's review) rather than those near to the Rialto and St Mark Square. This place was quieter, but we had everything we wanted, good and reasonably priced food and nice shops to buy souvenirs. It was just a 40 mins walk to St Marks' Square. Even all public transport(ferry & bus station&train station) was very near to the hotel.I would say it is at a strategic location. The room was clean and comfortable. It is newly renovated and decorated well. Owners (Rossana & Marina and all staff) are nice and helpful. Breakfast was adequate.Thank you. -Anita-

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KikaRostand
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of blocks from the train station, close to everything. Very clean, comfortable. Be aware that there are stairs to the hotel and then to the upper floor (no elevators). Breakfast is ok (nothing much). Room has AC, but no minifridge. I was happy with my choice of hotel. Staff was friendly. Bathroom is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraTraveler
Reviews.Content: Super Clean, Friendly and very accommodating staff, Great breakfast, Walking distance to the train station, Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marie_Sol_11
Reviews.Content: When we got to Venice we were looking for a comfortable and good cost â€“ benefit accommodation, and we found more than that; a lovely place with a nice modern decor, good location (it was close to the train station) and where we were treated like home. It surpassed our expectations. Very good and recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ivicajr
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay in adriatico. great small family hotel. clean, stylish, friendly personal at the great location (between piazalle roma and rialto). my best stay in venice ever, we stayed day more because of great mood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antoanet63
Reviews.Content: My son and I were in a hotel on the Adriatic 13.08. to 16.08. The hotel is small but has all the amenities. The hotel is perfectly located near the train station to bus and boats. Breakfast is continental but sufficient. The staff is very friendly, ready to help. I recommend the hotel to all who want to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Zemkova
Reviews.Content: It was third trip to Venice and first time we stayed directly in the city. We choose this hotel, because of very nice price and location. We came late and we were terribly tired, so we knew it would not be easy to walk long distance with luggage. That`s why Adriatico Hotel was a good solution for those, who have heave luggage. 10 minutes walk from Piazza Roma, maximum 5 minutes from train station. The room was clean. Little bit small for 3 persons, but we were in Venice just to sleep a few hours during 2 nights, so it was ok for us. Actually its not easy to find large apartment in Venice and not for this price. It was also quiet. The breakfast could be better, little bit poor. And if you are not ready to have a breakfast at 8 a.m., but little bit later, so you should wait for free table. It wasn`t a problem for us. No free WiFi. I will stay definitely again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mrichiso
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and close to the trains station. Breakfast is provided. It's good but not very fancy. Pros : the AC was great, clean towels, breakfast, close to the train station. Friendly staff. Quiet rooms. Cons: no wireless, rooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: ekrobertson
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk from Ferrovia Train Station and various vaparetto stops makes this little gem an unbeatable find. Situated in Cannaregio which is an area with much historical significance but is also residentail i.e. venetians live there it, is not laden with 5 star hotels or well heeled tourists, you could not hope for a better locale. The hotel itself is spotless, super friendly staff and all the mod cons you could hope for in a small hotel that possibly has 8 - 10 rooms max. The dining area where continental breakfast is served is small but comfortable; pristine furnishings, and a lovely way to start your morning by chatting with your fellow guests. Our bedroom was great - wide windows that when opened looked over the main street and let in the sounds of Venice and a view of the passing parade yet at night when you closed the windows and put on the aircon it was dead quiet (the benefits of double glazing). We stayed 4 days and we plan on staying there again when we visit Italy again next year. We loved Venice and this little hotel made our stay just that much more memorable. It's popular so I recommend that you reserve ahead and request the front facing room; you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benzy1977
Reviews.Content: I was a solo female traveler in venice italy. I stayed at the Hotel Adriatico for three nights. The hotel is located approximately 5 minutes from the main train station, water taxis, and public transport and there are many restaurants in the vicinity. The location made it very easy for me to come home in the late afternoon for a litte nap/freshen up before engaging in night activities. Although the hotel is in a lively neighborhood I did not hear any noise at night (my room faced the back of the hotel). The room was very clean and the towels and bed linen were changed every day. The room had airconditoiner, a flat screen TV, and telephone. They had wireless internet access for a fee. I chose to go down the street to an internet cafe. They served breakfast but I did not eat at the hotel since there were so many bakeries in the area. I interacted with two staff persons at the reception area and they were both polite and answered any questions that I had. The male receptionist had a great sence of humor! As a female traveling alone I felt very safe in the hotel. For approximately 70 Euros this is a great deal!! I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: originalredtag
Reviews.Content: During my stay on 20 May 2011 I had some medical issues which took me to the emergency room at the hospital that evening. I did not return until after 0100 on 21 May. Your man Luciano at the desk was excellent: he told us exactly where to get the closest vaporetto, where to get off and where the hospital would be. He said the hotel would close at 1100, but we should ring whenever we returned. When we returned, he immediately opened the door--he said he had called the hospital and found that we had left, so he stayed to let us in. What service! We have stayed at the Adriatico before and were very pleased with the room, the location, the breakfast, and the courtesy and efficiency of the staff. Now we are doubly sure to stay there next time in Venice. We highly recommend your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a family”
Reviews.Author: Mbombr
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, not overly expensive as Venice goes but best of all is the great location near the train station. Very easy to find especially when you all have luggage. Once you have toured Venice, you'll appreciate the ease of finding this hotel. We had a family room for four and the kids room had a door for nice privacy for all. The staff was nice and did their best with English.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE VALUE - ESPECIALLY FOR VENICE”
Reviews.Author: tommytigertail
Reviews.Content: Firstly - 500 yards from station (5 minutes walk). Secondly, I thought it would be noisy. It was not. Perfect location. Lovely breakfasts. Hostess charming!!

Reviews.Title: “great price, location and value”
Reviews.Author: JunoBeachGreenberg
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel. It is convenient to the train, Piazzale Roma and only a 45 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and the Piazza San Marco. It is very clean, great bathrooms and the owners and staff are very friendly and helpful. The a/c even worked. really great value for the money. Only negative is the small breakfast room and selection, but that would not stop me from returning or recommending this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: cklux
Reviews.Content: thank you, verry perfect. Home very clean good, excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice little hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Aggepop
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriatico is very close to the bus-and train station and the rooms are inexpensive. We had a lovely room facing the street. The two sisters that own the hotel and the rest of the staff was very friendly and gave us the best of service.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient but much more than that”
Reviews.Author: TeresinaSWEngland
Reviews.Content: This smart little hotel could not be more convenient for those who arrive in Venice via the railway station or by bus at Piazzale Roma. The rooms are finished to modern standards and have always been very clean on the 5 or 6 times I have stayed there. The members of staff have been friendly and courteous even on the few occasions when I have arrived very late from Marco Polo Airport. Breakfast is in modest continental style but commensurate with hotels in this price range. It has been possible for me to leave my luggage there on those days when my departure has been late afternoon. Then, when it is time to go, there is only a short walk from the hotel to the station/bus station. When in Venice I always use this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing with Venice”
Reviews.Author: CEmanuele
Reviews.Content: Very nice place and close to wherever you want to go

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean and very well managed”
Reviews.Author: JustWilliam_10
Reviews.Content: Close to Station so no trundling around the biggest rabbit warren ( with steps) in the world to find you Hotel. Great management - highly experienced, small rooms but with everything we needed and kept ultra clean with sympathetic cleaners when we had had too much the night before. Great value, simple breakfasts and super restaurants close by. Internet charged at 2 euro an hour which I think is very short sighted- it should ALWAYS be free.

Reviews.Title: “Dare going there just if you money to chuck....”
Reviews.Author: ericamxpt
Reviews.Content: Our room was literally between the reception and the breakfast hall so during the night we were awaken all the time by people coming back and in the morning by the person who was laying the tables and of course by everybody who was leaving and having breakfast! The room was so small that there was no place to place the suitcase,we had just one bedside table since there was no place for a second one. There was no wardrobe,actually there was a fake one,a sort of library with panels where you couldn't even hang a coat. We asked for a shower mat and we got a very old one. The room and the building itself are very old,but actually what is scary are the facilities themselves. Hot drinks were dipensed by an automatic machine,and the choice for food was between, bread, cereals and one kind of croissant. Never had a breakfast as bad as this.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel - would return!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen37
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for being near transport links - 2 mins from train station/vap stops/5 mins from bus station. Hotel/room exceptionally clean, room lovely and all staff very friendly and helpful! I was in one of the 3 rooms near reception and there was some noise from when people were checking out late on occasion, but no noise from outside at all. This didn't bother me, and I doubt there would have been any noise in any of other rooms. I especially loved that this hotel uses genuine Philippe Starck Louis (in the rooms) and Victoria ghost chairs in the breakfast room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location/nice and clean decoration”
Reviews.Author: steenheilesen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated few minutesâ€™ walk from the railway station and one vapretto stop from Piazzale Roma (Venice's gateway for land transportation). There are many shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel is convenient for access by vapretto all places on the island. It is a little hotel with only 12 rooms. The rooms are small ditto the bathroom. We had a room directly to the busy street below and there was no noise. The room has air-condition and central heating. The bed was comfortable and the room and bathroom clean. I like the marble floor which is cleaner than carpets. The breakfast is simple. I couldnâ€™t get the wireless access for my I-Pad in my room but a lan-connection is possible. You have to pay for the internet access. It would be a PLUS if the internet access was free. I havenâ€™t stayed at other hotels in Venice but comparing the price per night with other 2-star hotels the price is at the high end, however the location and the atmosphere would make me choose the hotel if I returned to Venice. The staff is very friendly. View photos from Venice; http://www.flickr.com/photos/steenheilesen/collections/72157625246481904/

Reviews.Title: “great location good value for money and riendly staff”
Reviews.Author: grahamd48
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights close to train station and station for water buses and bus station , clean and comfortable accomodation , friendly staff would def stay there again

Reviews.Title: “2 stars..dont shine so bright...”
Reviews.Author: TravelVav
Reviews.Content: .. mold.. check .. noise.. check, rude staff , check yep, that's what you get when you stay at the Adriatico hotel in Venice. I imagine that they dont care too much as to what the customer needs when paying 120 Euros a night.. otherwise, they would put more effort into making this hotel a desirable destination. I'd like to think of my reviews on TripAdvisor as fair, and I will add and say that the location is good - but, aside from this advantage.. not much else to report on. One last warning.. if you do stay there, dont under any circumstances agree to take the room next to the reception , unless you dont mind 'sleeping' in it.. because the noise level from the street is nothing in comparison to what you'll get from the staff sitting at the reception !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, decently sized room, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: kicca
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is above a shoe store (I thought it was a good sign for a shoe addict), 5 minutes from the train station (with no bridges to cross), and near the main water transportation stations. Reception is upstairs, though, and there is no elevator. I loved the location and I was greeted by very very friendly staff. It is on Lista di Spagna (the largest and most crowded "street" connecting the train station to the Rialto area), but my window was on a side "calle" and my room was quiet. I was in a room with 3 beds and it was maybe a little tight, but... not bad. I would still say "decently sized". The bathroom was clean. Odd hair dryer that reminded me of a vacuum cleaner. Ah, the staff was great! I loved talking to Luciano! Breakfast is definitely not big, but it has the basics to get you started for a great day of exploring this great city. I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality/price relation in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sergioph
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay in Hotel Adriatico in Venice. The property is not very big, but it's very comfy. Located near the Santa LucÃ­a Railway Station and good connections with the most important lines of vaporetto, Hotel Adriatico offers the right place to stay when you arrive in Venice. The breakfast it's not a big buffet, but well, it has anything you can eat in the morning when you wake up. The staff is also very nice and very gentile, and they offer you a lot of information about the city and restaurants to go where meals are not so expensive like other places in Venice and in which people from the city go usually. The only problem that you can find is that if your room is orientated to Lista de Spagna, the noise can make you wake up too early. But, honestly, I would go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AP_1Australia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights whilst in Venice. I could not believe how close it is to the train station. We walked to the hotel with our luggage, that's how close the train station is. Most convenient! It is also very close to the water bus station. We were greeted by a very friendly gentleman and we found all the other staff members at reception to be welcoming, friendly and hospitable. The rooms were clean and roomy. Breakfast room is very small compared to other hotels I stayed at but it was cosy. The breakfast was also nice but not much variety. However it was sufficient for a good start to the day. You definitely are not hungry! There are also inexpensive places to eat at close to the hotel that have some of the best food I've ever tried. There is a pizza and kebab place very close by that the friendly gentleman at the hotel recommended as well as other places that serve delicious food without the price tag. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay when your in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mazingmarts
Reviews.Content: Great location - just a couple of minutes walk for either mode of transportation, bus/train/waterbus. Don't be fooled by the small entrance, once inside, the hotel is nothing short of a four start. Great rooms with all necessary amenities. But the one thing that made Venice one of the best experiences in Italy was the staff. Everyone was very co-operative and helpful. We were skeptical about getting our value for money at this hotel, but at the end of our trip, we feel it was the best money spent, worth every cent. Absolutely no complaints! If you are planning on a trip to venice, this is one of the best places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Daughter is a Hero for picking”
Reviews.Author: Mikehiggins11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Adriatico was a welcome visit and had everything you could hope, we are new to travel in Europe and wonder what more one could expect from a five star hotel. Thanks for the prefect visit!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location, Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: Charlene80
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is very central - so good location close to the train and bus station as well as many shops and restaurants. Although it is centrally located, you can sleep with the windows open as there is very little noise. The help with my many questions and alternations at reception was before and during our stay - excellent. The staff is friendly and always smiling, the rooms are clean, modern, well isolated and pretty and the breakfast is all you need. The only minor problem was that the room's safe wasn't working. But all in all, an excellent 2-star hotel (feels like a 3 star). Good choice and I will definitively be staying here again! Grazie!!!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: gaylordm
Reviews.Content: We wished we stayed longer. The hotel is really close to the train station, so easy and convenient to get there with luggage. Our room was ready at 9am (we came in on an early train). Lots of white marble, immaculately clean, fresh and a very restful after the bustle of Venice. Lots of good restaurants and easy shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice”
Reviews.Author: TildaLondon
Reviews.Content: It`s second time I stay in this hotel because of it`s location , quality of it`s staff and bedrooms. The condition of the hotel is immaculate . The location is perfect to get Murano and San Marco Square , airport and train station. We were very well treated and enjoyed our time there. Tilda Dal Pozzo London

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, helpful, clean...a pleasure to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: YogaKarma
Reviews.Content: Marina and the staff were very friendly and helped me with my travel questions about Venice. The breakfast was tasty, my room was clean and my bed was comfy, slept well, it was a pleasure to stay there, not that i was there very much, most of my time was spent exploring beautiful Venice and it's islands. The Hotel location was great, very close to bus, train, ferry and water taxis, close to so many interesting sights and quiet areas of Venice away from most tourists. I got the alilaguna water taxi from the airport to Guglie then walked over the bridge to the Hotel in a few minutes, it was easy! Great bars and restaurants around the Hotel too. Grazie Venice & Adriatico, ciao :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Aug 2009. The hotel is small and very basic. If you are looking for a place to stay with no frills, I recommend the Hotel Adriatico. The room is fairly tidy and the staff was friendly. The only real complaint I had was the air conditioning. It could have been turned up higher. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay and would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “has been a special place...”
Reviews.Author: PelliBergamo
Reviews.Content: the Adriac hotel is situated in a strategic position. It us comfortable because it is very close to the rail station, close to the ferry embarkation, close to the down town. The hotel and the rooms are very nice and clean, the people who work for the Adriatico Hotel are very polite, available and with a strong knowledg about the story of Venezia, the best places to visit and the best restaurant with a good compromise within quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable price related to service quality and the place”
Reviews.Author: Jerrry
Reviews.Content: Acceptable price related to service quality and the place; limited room space but nice furnitured, poor outlook through the window that makes the room too dark, good looking and clean bathroom, service ok, professional and helpful receptionists speaking English, perfect location for the city sightseeing, it's worth to recommend due to the price level.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Hotel very clean & modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: noamIL
Reviews.Content: stayed in Hotel Adriatico for 2 nights in mid september ,the hotel is within 10 minutes walks from the train station which I found very convenience & easy to reach ,hotel located on a busy street with many shops and restaurants however the rooms are very quiet & clean (Good odor everywhere) be expected that room size could be smaller for some pepoles,I didn't had a problem with that since I booked a double room for single . each room have an air condition unit ,flat tv ,small closet ,table with clear plastic chair ,night stand and Private renovated shower and toilet .windows don't have screens so make sure you keep tham close all times otherwise you'll find Moskitos everywhere. it's could be nice if thay had in room safe and mini bar . the Breakfast room is very small and can handle only 10 pepoles each time, Breakfast is very basic . everytime I had to leave the hotel thay ask me to leave the keys at the front desk considering the high prices in venice it's was a good value for the money ,if you are planing to stay for more than 3 nights you might look for a bigger hotel .

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC and VA in US
Reviews.Title: “A terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Washington_DCer
Reviews.Content: I just came back from our vacations, US->Paris->Rome->Florence->Pisa->Venice. Staying in this hotel was really a big mistake I made during the entire trip. I spent 330 Euro for the two night stays in the early of the Sept. and got a "suite" on the reservation. First, it turned out to be that the suite in the hotel is so tiny, even based on European standard, so that you will have to sequence into any rooms. And, it hardly have any sunshine in the room. The hotel is relatively clean, but very very tiny and basic. Secondly, there isn't much to eat for the breakfast by any standard. We had to look for other places to have breakfast for kids during the stay. Last, the staffers are not really helpful in any way. On the arrival night, we asked the staffer about nearby local causal restaurant and was directed to a place of his "friend and partner"s. When I was in Venice, I found another very nice 4 star hotel nearby and you just need to pay 20 Euro more per nigh. But unfortunately it was too late for us to switch. Compared with other hotels we stayed in Paris, Rome and Florence, this one is really a cheap hotel in term of quality and services.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: famaro77
Reviews.Content: Very clean and with elegantly simple furniture. Breakfast was simple but very proper as the hotel. Very decent and well placed, close to the train station. Altought the room was directly above one of the main streets, it was very quiet and confortable. I would stay there again if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice quality/price”
Reviews.Author: jomacoar
Reviews.Content: Good location, small accomodations but very clean and pleaseant. All staff is kind and always ready to help. We were satisfied with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping for one night”
Reviews.Author: mannnyOslo
Reviews.Content: We passed through Venice and stayed one night before travelling north. We needed a place near the railway station and not far from the busses. The hotel had a perfect location for our needs. Small room but clean and nice enough and with air condition. Breakfast could have been better and the breakfast room was rather small. If you're staying one night or a few nights and don't need a big and luxerious hotel, adriatico could be your choice. Staff was very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Above All Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: dancingjack
Reviews.Content: My partner and I searched for hours for an available room but was to no avail. The hotels were either fully booked or they were too expensive. There were a few hotels along the small alleys which were had price to match but it seemed dhodgy, so we avoided them and continue searching till we found this hotel. We were greeted with warmth and we were given the opportunity to view the rooms before we committed to them. It was very well furnished and the rooms were extremely clean. Breakfast was simple.

Reviews.Title: “A smart and friendly small hotel conveniently close to the station and Piazzale Roma.”
Reviews.Author: TeresinaSWEngland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed the Hotel Adriatico four times and have always found the staff welcoming even when arriving late at night after a delayed flight. The location is excellent for getting to and from the bus station at Piazzale Roma or the railway station.This is especially appreciated when arriving on later flights into Marco Polo airport. and when arriving or departing by train.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great cost-effectiveness”
Reviews.Author: bivf
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, near the main train station. There are many shops and restaurants around, and you can reach the main touristic attractions easily. Is not the cheapest hotel, but the rooms are great, nice bathroom, very confortable beds, with safe. The hotel is very clean, and the breakfast is very good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: italiantravelbug
Reviews.Content: Nice family owned hotel, close to the train station and water taxis. Easier to get to with luggage than some of the island hotels. Clean and simple rooms, nothing fancy, no elevator though. My mother had some trouble with the steps.

Reviews.Title: “Cool - clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: brookscene
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight before and after a cruise. The Adriatico is an easy walk from the main bus depot Piazzala Roma in from the airport . there is a reliable luggage drop at the bus depot. From there a free shuttle bus takes you direct to your ship . We found the hotel was what we wanted Reasonable price (for Venice) -quiet ; with a simple breakfast included to get you on your way. I wouldn't spend a week there ; but for a no hassle overnight it could help you relax after a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “Well located,clean,friendly Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Elaine018
Reviews.Content: A small attractive,friendly Hotel.Very clean.Good breakfast.Family went out of their way to make my stay comfortabe.Happy with my room.Great location for travel from airport.Vaperetto stops nearby so easy to get about Venice.Near station too if you wish to travel in the region.Shops and restaurants on your doorstep,also a small market nearby.Hotel on a busy thoroughfare,but easy to reach quieter streets.A short walk from the Hotel you can explore the Cannaregio area,where beautiful walkwaysand canals are located.Quieter,less touristy,and cheaper cafes etc.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great little hotel fantastic value, location and spotless”
Reviews.Author: jellycatDublin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel so close to everything. you can get the boat up the canal to San Marco or you can get the boat out to the Lido. Lovely staff very friendly and welcoming. Great value and always kept really clean, would strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Cleanliness Room”
Reviews.Author: florence44e
Reviews.Content: Very closed to train station so that very convenience. Besides, closed to resturants and shops. Room is cleanliness and staffs are friendly. So I must recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Marianne1112Oslo
Reviews.Content: We were a group and many were staying at your hotel. The first day we had som arguing to get breakfast around 7 in the morning, but the days after it was ok. Breakfast schould be available at least from 7 o'clock.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTony
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice little place to stay in the northern area of Venice. It is very close to the train station, vaporetto stops, as well as to the P.le Roma. It is very easy to find - a plus in Venice. It's a long walk (30-40min) to St Marks. Overall no major issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WayToGoGo
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, near rail and bus station. Clean. Good bed. Good shower. TV in room, but who goes to Venice to watch TV? Location is excellent as a base for exploring Venice. Had a double for single at â‚¬100.- per night incl breakfast (this was mid-April). Take a boat (public transport boatbus) in from the airport (5 min along a well marked path) for â‚¬13.- and you are two "blocks" from the hotel! Only disappointment was a rather meagre "packaged" breakfast, but with cafÃ©s and fruit stalls all over, it is perhaps just as well to breakfast out. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: vingi59
Reviews.Content: I was in Hotel Adriatico in march 2009 with my wife. We haven't got reservation, anyway we found the hotel immadiatly, and there was a free room for us. The place of the hotel is very comfortable. It is near by parking, and also you can walk everywhere in the city from it. The room was very clear, well suited. The price is reasonable, it is relevant to the service. The best think about the hotel, that the personal is very very kind, helpful and polite. So all together Hotel Adriatico is a best choice, if you want to live in Venice for a reasonable price with convenient conditions. Istvan (Hungary)

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectation”
Reviews.Author: rssharmaji
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for wife and my daughter. It was during the off season so the price was right. It was remodelled, the room was very neat and cozy and you can't beat the location, few minutes from the bus stop to go to Marco polo airport. The breakfast was good and included in the price. One good thing about staying right in venice is when you get tired walk to the hotel relax for an hour or two and then head back to sightseeing places. My family really liked the place. The price goes up during the peak season and for some this may become little pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Verry Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Rony_rony
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. A little expensive but very good. Very close to station. I am English speaking and had no problems with communicating. Infact the lady at reception keeps a dictionary. when i said "blanket". she could not understand and asked me to show in the dictionary. This type of service is rare in Italy. Only one thing. The shower was very small. But not sure if all rooms have so. But i would not complain. i went to spend my anniversary and loved staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Isibina
Reviews.Content: Our guide was TripAdvisor - we wasn't disapointed. We booked via their website - with a great offer only 65 euros for night, early booking. Hotel is tiny, has breakfast included and it is a very high quality 2 star hotel. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable, simply but nice decorated and bath is spotless. Also, the room has excellent central heating and AC. The location is excellent if you are arriving by train or bus and it is only five minutes walk from bus station(Piaza di Roma) or train station(Santa Lucia). Also, are plenty of shops and eating options around. So, I recommend this hotel to everyone who has planned to go to Venice. It is a perfect hotel at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money in good location”
Reviews.Author: sacDorsetUk
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights. Room at the front so a bit of street noise but room comfortable with good size shower room. Travelling with friends who had stayed previously.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a jewel city”
Reviews.Author: lindiva
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel (Albergo) Adriatico by Googling two star hotels Venice. I booked via their website - which looked too good to be true. However, when we got there it was just lovely. A family-run boutique hotel, decked in marble, breakfast included, very reasonable rates. A very high quality 2 star hotel. We decided to stay for 8 nights instead of the 2 originally booked. Made a lovely week in Venice even lovelier, even though highest Aqua Alta for 44 years the first morning we were there made things very interesting. Only negative comment was the wireless internet rates - v.expensive unless they've found a cheaper one since! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorenzogranada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, found it by walking down the main street in Venice coming from the train station, it was about the fourth hotel on the left. The first ones were rather dumpy, stuffy and a bit expensive for the off season. Hotel Adriatico is quite different because it is in a tiny, gabled house, there can't be more than a dozen rooms. It had just been completely renovated, one flight walk up to a small airy lobby with breakfast room overlooking the street. Our room was small but very comfortable, simply but tastefully decorated, excellent electrical arrangements and toilet with shower, all for 65 euros a day (November rate). From there it is just a pleasant walk down to the Rialto. I have been in Venice several times and will certainly go back to this hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Your two star plus home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MaltaCasper
Reviews.Content: Great find in Venice. If you are looking for a cosy, clean and welcoming place to stay. Search no further. This hotel offers the elite in two star hotels. I wonder why its missing its third star. Rooms are comfy and very cosy. The room had excellent central heating and it was a pleasure to walk into after below zero tempreature outside!!! Staff were always courteous and i appreacitated the fact that although we arrived late in the night the receptionist still gave full information and tips.The location is excellent if you are arriving by train or bus at ackward hours as it is only five minutes walk from bus station/train station. The hotel is situated on Lista de spagna a road filled with shops. caffes and restuarants moving onto strada nuova and to the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location contrasted with mediocre hospitality”
Reviews.Author: gabes80
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent if planning for quick departure/arrival to Venice by train/bus. Plenty of shops and eating options around. Up-sides : good clean hotel, very functional. Perhaps we caught the hotel in a busy period, during the architectual bienalle. We paid seemed an exorbitant rate, but in the context of Venice - was probably the going price (140 euros for twin). Breakfast isn't anything to write home about, but we found the staff members to be rather curt. Final insult - on day of checking out, unable to leave bags due to lack of space - extra 20 euros spent at the railway station. (such is travel) Having said that, I didn't come to Venice for my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brenoka
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this nice hotel for 1 day. Actually for a few hours. Once I was in Venice for only a running-fast day, all I needed was a roof over my head and a good bed to lay down. Location is really a good deal. Just 5 minutes from Termini Station Staff were superb! They gave me a map and explained me all they could for what would be the most interesting sightseeings and walking tours for just a day. Also they gave me hints to choose good restaurants at a reasonable price. But what was really awesome: I had to checkout too early in the morning (about 5am). Usually breakfast is taken place from 8am to 10am. For my great surprise, they opened the breakfast room for me at 5 am so that I could take something! Summing up all of these experiences, I recommend this hotel to everyone who has planned to go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: CIVGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one saturday night in July. Although it was a bit pricy (120euro due to the fact that it was saturday), it is very well looked after, very clean and in general a great value for its money in Venice. Most hotels offer much much less and a not clean and nice and the difference is only say 30euros so this hotel is worth it. I would for sure recommend it for a romantic weekend. As a very frequent business traveller (2 international trips a month) I visit many 5* hotels and usually pay 300+ a night. This room was small but offered everything one could want even in higher category hotels. (Remember in Southern Europe the hotel rooms and bathrooms are generally smaller than in the US) Anyway, when one goes to venice one does not spend the day (or night) in the room but is outside enjoying the city. I recommend it 100%. CV. Greece

Reviews.Title: “A Find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: enevieve
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Venice we found that our hotel had overbooked and had no room available for our first night there. The hotel was called the Albergo Adriatico and we went there. It has just been redecorated/refurbished and our room was lovely. There is a small breakfast area in the lobby which was nicely furnished. Breakfast was good and ample. Two sisters run the hotel - and they are very pleasant - advising us on restaurants, etc. The hotel was close to a stop for the boats and a short walk from the railway station. We had no trouble taking our own luggage to the station. Also - it was less expensive than the original hotel we had booked and much much nicer. Easy to take the boat down to the main part of Venice - picturesque ride as well. You will enjoy your stay here - nice shops nearby and great ice cream sold in booths on the street. Carol Transou from Johnson City, Tn

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Rusalka
Reviews.Content: Although my friend and I stayed only for one night, we were unbelievably pleasantly surprised with everything about the hotel. The location is great, the room clean, new and the staff very friendly. And the price was more than affordable. It always seems like a matter of luck with hotels in Venice, but I would definitely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rejaCroatia
Reviews.Content: I've spent an amazing weekend with my friend in Venice form June 6-8 2008. We came tired form the train around 8am and nice lady at the reception offered us to go in our room right away and rest, since we traveled all night. That was so nice of her and really made our Saturday in Venice more relaxing. The hotel was great. We had a room with 2 beds. Everything was very clean and newly furnished. Anyway this hotel deserves 3 stars, at least... We are coming again, for shore.

Reviews.Title: “review about hotel Adriatico”
Reviews.Author: MoscowElena
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel from 29 April to 02 May 2008. There is very clean and comfortable. It is nearly from historical center of Venice. We like it at all :).

Reviews.Title: “Best two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19fifty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it to be very clean, reasonably priced & being so close to the railway station it was easy to find. My room had a shared bathroom which was basically next door & it was spotless plus everything worked perfectly. Breakfast was included in the price & whilst it was really a typical continental breakfast it was self serve & so much better than what I had in Rome at a similar priced hotel. The owners were friendly & pleasant & although they were not experts in English certainly had sufficient knowledge to communicate without too much difficulty. I found the hotel's position to be well placed as it is only 2-3 minutes walk from the station (no bridges to cross) & just so convenient for sightseeing. Overall I found it to be excellent value especially as it was summer when I was there & would stay there again if I am fortunate enough to return to Venice one day & can recommend it to anyone, apart from maybe quite elderly or disabled tourists as it is not on the ground floor & there is unfortunately no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Venice2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with this hotel. It was clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Could not check in when we first arrived. When we went back our luggage was already in our room. Room is small but it met our needs. Breakfast is simple. If you want fancy and expensive stay in San Marco. Good location. About 5 minute walk to the train station and the ferry. About a 30 minute walk to San Marco which is nice because you see so much of the city by walking. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap in the heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: ellie79
Reviews.Content: small hotel not far from the train station, st. Lucia. clean all over, but very small and a bit depressing room. all whitewashed with views on the front wall...with the smallest double bed I've ever seen! or the biggest single, if u prefere. even the shower wasn't that big, and there was only one for a whole corridor. get ready to wait in the queue. nice breakfast, but very small breakfast room. we ate on a table near the stairs....weird! but, still, u'r in venice, and for 70 euros for a double...what can you expect! I would honestly go back, because for that price we got what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: VictorianTraveller
Reviews.Content: I arrived during a trip with my father and it was a great stay, the staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and comfy, and it was a great part of town for accessing the city. My father forgot his camera and the staff even arranged for it to be sent back to Canada!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel but also a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: lorraine75
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights in May 2007 and it went from bad to worse. Bedroom was tiny, the "double" bed tinier still. No room even to open a suitcase on the floor. Mad dog barking in the bedroom next door. Breakfast was abysmal - orange squash, diluted until tasteless, from a machine, likewise with tea and coffee, and awful prepacked croissants. The hotel owner (a man) ignored each guest, not a word was spoken by him, nor did he even glance in your direction, it was as if you were a great intrusion for him. Then to cap it all the electricity went in our room which meant two days with no air conditioning, hairdryer, iron etc. Did they care? Absolutely not - no way was he willing he wouldn't call out an electrician, he was waiting for a friend of a friend (cheap no doubt) who would perhaps come the following afternoon. So, on checking out we suggested a discount for the lack of electricity. No surprises there - zero discount. My final advice as someone who has travelled the world over - DON'T STAY THERE - it was the worst hotel I ever stayed in, and that includes third world hotels. It made Fawlty Towers look like The Ritz!! Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ClaudeCassagne
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what I was looking for. It is literally 5 minutes' walk from the Santa Lucia train station. As soon as I stepped off the train and saw the boats and the lagoon I fell in love with Venice. The hotel is fantastically located and I quite enjoyed my daily walks to San Marco or other places. I seldom got lost and if I did it was an enjoyable experience providing me with fantastic photos and souvenirs. I liked the BREK self-service restaurant down the Lista di Spagna toward the train station: no cover charge, no tips, quick get-it-yourself food and no waiting for the bill! I had more important things to do than sitting in overpriced restaurants waiting for silly waitstaff to bring me my bill. The night guy at the hotel spoke no English and my Italian is skeletal. Still, I learned how to say my room number and we understood each other. Venice is THE city in Italy..not Florence..not Rome. The fact that there are no cars, buses, bikes, vespas or anything motorized in Venice is a HUGE PLUS and I enjoyed all the bridges, canals, little streets, everything!

Reviews.Title: “charmed....”
Reviews.Author: CorkCola
Reviews.Content: hotel adriatico lives up to all the good reviews that I looked at before booking. It's quite basic but very clean and has all that you could need. It is run by lovely people,who despite not having much English, try their best to accomodate you. I even had a gift left in my room for my birthday....it's always the little things that count! The location was ideal, close to public transport while also encouraging one to walk and explore their way to St. Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice and made the short walk to the Hotel Adriatico. Its in a great location, but made for small people. After going up the narrow staircase we checked in. We were given keys to the room. We opted for the shared bathroom (for the price). The room itself was pretty small, but was fine. However the double bed was truly a double. Hardly room for my husband and myself. To make matters worse the bed completely sunk in the middle. It was a very cozy three nights in that bed. Other than that, the shower was seperate from the toilet/sink area which was convenient and our room did have a sink in it, which was nice. However, we had to pay 2 euro to get bath towels from the hotel. We also used the air conditioning, which was one of the few we were able to get to work or was turned on throughout our Italian honeymoon, so that was nice. The tv was the standard small television as we found in all our other rooms in Italy. Everything was clean. Breakfast was very basic, coffee or tea (from a caraffe, no cappucinnos) and a roll, packaged croissant and yogurt. My husband hit his head on the doorway the first 2 days we were there (he's 6'3). Venice was a wonderful city, and the hotel was fine, but we'd probably try a different hotel next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Adriatico
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 224 | Lista di Spagna, 30121 Venice, Italy
